name: ASIMo-V (Demo)
description:
ASIMo-V is a sci-fi, narrative-focused environmental puzzle game currently being developed in Unreal Engine 4.  The player assumes the role of a maintenance android (Automated System Intelligence Module-V) on a space station and is gradually rewarded with hints explaining the narrative mystery.  Mechanics revolve around dynamic gravity, such as navigating zero-g areas and walking on the walls and ceiling.

ASIMo-V began as a student project with Isaac Madsen, Galen Sipes, Samantha Silvers, and later Judith Carpio.  Though everyone is busy with other responsibilities, Isaac and Galen are beginning to continue development to bring the envisioned game into fruition.
